alert.note: Alert for Harper; Harvey; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 11:26PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sedgwick, eastern Harvey, northeastern Harper and northwestern Sumner Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1126 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Buhler to near Haven to 6 miles west of Cheney to 11 miles north of Harper to near Attica. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Newton, Haysville, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Goddard, Maize, Clearwater, North Newton, Sedgwick, Colwich, Conway Springs, Downtown Wichita, Kechi, Eastborough, Bentley, Walton, Viola, and West Wichita. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 37. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 39 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Kansas.
